root: ^This customer was ringing the bell so aggressively you are almost tempted to ignore it.
^But, duty calls. Reception chores aren’t going anywhere any time soon.
^The amount of energy put into the simple greeting is far too much to handle this early in the day. You offer a lazy half attempt at a wave back.
^“I don’t know if you remember, but I checked in late last night, and I was just wandering about to get a lay of the land…scope out the turf you could say.”
^For someone claiming to be “wandering” she seems oddly tight strung.
^“I thought I’d come and chat with some of the lovely staff of your, uh, nice establishment.”
^“Isn’t the purple carpet just… so… colorful!”
^Her attempts at flattery mean nothing to you. Besides, you kind of hate the ugly purple carpet.
^You’re not really supposed to express ill will towards the decor as your Boss picked it out.
^She is clearly hanging about waiting for something… do you want to engage?
^It is too early in the morning for this.

goodjob: ^She stares at you blankly for a minute before ceasing her zoning out.
^“Huh? Oh, me? Nah! Thanks for asking though. Very kind of you!!!”
^You are left more confused than before… who comes to the main desk of a hospitality establishment to do anything besides asking for help?
tired: ^You suddenly have no idea what you were trying to achieve here.
^You probably should be doing your actual job by greeting the guests correctly. Oh well.
spacedout: ^“Sorry, was I spacing out again? I completely forgot why I came here…”
^“Hi, how are you? I’m Nessie, Nessie L, the L stands for Loch-"
^"Now I know that sounds sooo silly but I wasn’t in charge of picking my name…”
^Nessie goes on like this for several minutes.
^“... You see, I’ve come down here to this part of the woods to research some extra special flora and fauna, but it was such a hassle to make it here, I’m simply EXHAUSTED.”
^You feel like now is as good a time as any to interject her train of thought with your meager attempts at small talk.
^“Cool. So, what kind of science are you into?”
^“Oooh nobody ever asks me that! I’m a very qualified plant expert!!"
^"I mainly look into weird bits of wood that get stuck in lakes and river systems and the like.”
^"I am technically not a full scientist yet, but I’m working on it!!"
^You wonder where on earth is taking research interns that want to look at damp tree trunks.
^Are you really interested in learning about plant science?
^“All of this is going over my head.”
dumb: ^You thankfully admit that you are not a qualified scientist and therefore have nothing more to add to this conversation.
^“Awww mannn you’re no fun! I finally thought someone was actually taking an interest in my career."
^"I’ve heard there’s a famous author staying here too, there’s no way I can compete with that!!!”
^You smile remembering the state of said famous author this morning. I think the bar is pretty low- on the floor, even.
smart: ^You hurriedly spout out some words about seaweeds and the local lake foliage. It seems to work pretty well.
^“Yay, a fellow plant enthusiast?? SO COOL."
^She whispers it this time as if to prove some sort of point. You have to hand it to your new guest, she is actually kind of amusing.
^“Since you are a proven plant enthusiast, I can actually tell you the title of my research!"
^"I am looking into the effects of hydration on dead tree matter, particularly bark."
^"So basically, when wood is left in water for too long- how does that affect its molecular structure?”
^“Proper sciencey stuff. If my supervisors like it, then I will be all set for becoming a proper researcher!"
^"I work for the Scientific Institution for Aquatic Creatures, a very well known establishment.”
^She seems proud of her position. It's probably a big deal, even though you have never heard of it.
graphs: ^“I just know you’ll LOVE what I’m doing if I can show you some of my graphs!"
^“Uhhhh, lets see… where did I put them again????”
^“Sorry, just a minute, I won’t be long!”
^She dips onto the floor in a hurry, before resurfacing just as quickly.
^“I seem to have run into a minor problem… only a small one…”
^“I can’t find my computer anywhere… or my phone, come to think of it.”
^“I’m- I’m sure I just left it in my room!! I promise I’ll be back to show you all my cool stuff.”
^She speeds off into the distance at an alarming rate, rummaging frantically through the pockets of her lab coat.
^Looks like you dodged a bullet. No plant graphs? What a catastrophe.
